Comment: Trump has a history of using tariffs as a shakedown tactic:  >Research recently published in the Journal of Financial and Quantitative Analysis reveals that **politically connected companies were significantly more likely to receive valuable exemptions from the tariffs imposed on U.S. imports from China during the Trump administration**...  >...**companies that made substantial investments in political connections to Republicans prior to and during the beginning of the Trump administration were more likely to secure exemptions for products otherwise subject to tariffs.**  >Conversely, companies that made contributions to Democratic politicians had decreased odds of tariff exemption approval.  >"Our findings reveal that politicians not only use exemptions to reward their supporters, but also withhold exemptions to punish supporters of their opponents, The tariff exemption grant process functioned as a very effective spoils system, allowing the administration of the day to reward its political friends and punish its enemies."  >[https://phys.org/news/2025-01-politically-corporations-exemptions-tariffs-chinese.html](https://phys.org/news/2025-01-politically-corporations-exemptions-tariffs-chinese.html)  Trump is essentially engaging in a form of racketeering.  Give me something that I want, and I ease your pain.  You can safely assume that it won't be limited to Starlink.  Trump wants golf courses to be approved overseas, so let's trade tariff exemptions for approval.  Transfer some funds into Trump's cryptocurrency account, and your tariff pain is reduced or eliminated.  Trump sees government as a tool for embezzlement and theft.  Putin does it, and Trump admires him for it.
